p: T. matsutake is a forest ectomycorrhizal fungus and is predominantly associated with coniferous trees in northeastern China but has been found in broad–leaved forests consisting of Castanopsis spp., Quercus spp. and alpine shrubs 20 21 36 42 43. Therefore, the type of vegetation-environment suitable for T. matsutake is precisely known, and we defined two habitat suitability values for the vegetation type variable. A suitability value of 1 was used for coniferous, mixed coniferous, bushwood, and broad–leaved forests, and a suitability value of 0 was used for all other vegetation types. Because there are no explicit soil conditions for the growth of T. matsutake, we created a MaxEnt model that used only the soil type variables to assess the suitable requirements.
